page.title: 06Birds of Arden
page.content: The area is very rich in birds as it has trees,fields, moorland and houses. There are many birds of prey because they get smaller birds to kill here. The most popular bird of prey is the buzzard. It eats smaller birds and mice. The peregrine falcon kills the racing pigeons of a local resident. Crows and rooks fly over the school. There are waders such as curlews and peewits. Dippers live by the Fruin and a kingfisher has been seen by Cross Burn. The heron is usually seen in a field near the Duchlage Farm. At Muirland Cottages there are always house martins and swallows. They come about the end of April. There are many wood pigeons in the woods and the wood pecker can be heard. The tree creeper can be seen running up and down the trunks of trees. There are wagtails in the playground.
